name: Mama's Noodle House
address: 1782 Bay Ridge Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11204, USA

reviews.text: Sooooo gooooood.
Delicious
Small cozy place, can sit about 7 people. Owner was nice. My friend and I had house special noodle and Hot pot fish. It was delicious! Spicy level can be adjusted. Highly recommended

Brilliant food.

I have tried the chicken curry rice, fried pork dumplings, and the minced pork  noodles. All A+.

I will return.
Mommaâ€™s Noodle House is amazing! The food is delicious and comforting, and the friendly lady working in the restaurant made our visit even better. Highly recommendâ¤ï¸
Hole in the wall...very good food and service, always (thus far)....highly recommend.

The food was good. Cash or Zelle only. Small establishment. Tried eating at their
outside table but a Chinese guy (next door) decided it was his smoke break, was smoking and it was disgusting he had no consideration for someone else dining experience, I had to leave early.
Not a lot of seating, but the seats were comfy. The food was so yummy, I wished I lived next door. The lady was also so kind. Got three dishes and a coke for under $30!

Real small  mom and pop noodle shop
Serving up tasty food .
I enjoy to support local people especially when the food is tasty and delicious.

This is the BEST food Iâ€™ve ever had. Iâ€™m not even joking. Get the Shanghai noodles and hot + spicy wontonsâ€¦and the scallion pancakes were sooooo crispy. Iâ€™ve just never had such an explosion of flavor with all of those dishes. Canâ€™t wait to try more!!! Nan (sheâ€™s in charge) is the sweetest woman, she couldnâ€™t get over how many times we yelled how good the food was as we were eating in front of her, she was laughing.

The food is very good and healthy but I ordered for delivery today and the guy basically was forcing me for a higher tip and told me I wouldnâ€™t get my food without giving him a higher tip. Besides that itâ€™s pretty good the women is always welcoming and the food is good!
Absolutely delicious
Great food, kind owner and an affordable price
this is literally the greatest restaurant ever!
The food here is insane
Love this place! Small mom and pop restaurant I love their hot pot style noodle so much which I crave for frequently. They are amazing and kindest people.
delicious spicy wontons!
The best!!!! Amazing in every way, scallion pancakes were out of this world.

One of the best meals Iâ€™ve had in a long time. My wife and I shared scallion pancakes, fried pork dumplings, and the Basil Beef Ho Fun. Incredible food all around, and the owner/chef is a wonderfully sweet woman. Oh and the lemonade is fantastic.

I had the pleasure of visiting Mamaâ€™s Noodle House, located on Bay Ridge Avenue in Brooklynâ€”and what a delightful experience it was! From the moment I walked in, I was greeted with exceptional warmth and hospitality that made me feel like I was home.

Their signature House special MaMa Noodle Soup is absolutely phenomenal. The beef is perfectly braised until tender, practically melting in your mouth. Paired with springy hand-pulled noodles, fresh vegetables, marinated egg, and a rich, flavorful broth, every bite was a comforting explosion of flavor.

Itâ€™s no surprise that The New York Times has recommended this placeâ€”it truly lives up to the hype!

If youâ€™re in NYC and craving a bowl of soulful, authentic Chinese beef noodle soup, Mamaâ€™s Noodle House is a must-visit.

Had my food within 5 minutes. Warm service, the most freshest and delicious ingredients Iâ€™ve tasted without having to visit big time restaurants. Cheap compared to the flavor profile you receive. Do not hesitate just be careful about going with more than 2 people to eat in as the place is really small and is meant for carry out.
Food is fresh and delicious!
Delicious food. They make you feel like family. Highly recommend the fried pork dumplings. Very crispy and juicy.
This is my favorite little spot. I'm glad I found it.
I came here because of the good reviews, but my experience did not match them at all. Definitely not worth it. Would not recommend.

Mamaâ€™s is my favorite place to eat in all of New York â€¦ and maybe the whole world â€” go, go, go!!!

Go-tos are the dumplings (made fresh in house every day), scallion pancakes, mapo tofu and minced pork noodles. And always a lemon tea :)

Mama's is the best food on planet earth. If you're reading this, you must go now. It's my favorite eatery in the world (please don't tell my nonna). Mama is incredibly sweet and she and her partner make the most unbelievable noodles, dumplings, sauteed bok choy, fish, literally anything.
I never write reviews but this is by far my favorite place to eat in NYC. Phenomenal food and the owners are the warmest people. I commute 1hr+ each month to visit.
really good mom&pop store. We ordered the tomyum soup, hot and spicy wontons and house special noodles. They were all very tasty. I will be back to try other items from the menu. Hidden ğŸ’
Mama makes this an incredibly special place. Always with a smile and always gives freebies.  Probably my favorite restaurant in Brooklyn. 10 STARS very fresh food

Cute small shop tucked away in the corner of a street. The restaurant is small maybe barely 500 sq ft but on a cold rainy day when we visited, it felt welcoming and warm. Although there are no fancy decorations nor furniture, we opted to dine in since there werenâ€™t others when we visited. We did see multiple people coming in for take out orders. The ambiance feels like a small coffee shop/food stall with window seating but instead they serve delicious comfort Chinese food.

We got:
- House special Mama Noodle  10/10
- Basil Chicken Ho Fun                10/10
- Herbal Tea                                  10/10

Everything was so tasty here. Itâ€™s the perfect comfort food. The Mama Noodle is the best version of beef noodle soup Iâ€™ve had. I never liked how simple beef noodle soup is but this version is loaded with everything. You not only get the tender & juicy beef cube and homemade noodles - you also get curry fish balls, tofu, hard boiled eggs, topped with plenty of vegetables! Itâ€™s so good especially on a cold rainy day. The perfect dish.

We wanted to try a dry noodle dish as well and the basil ho fun was delicious! One of the highlight was the house made (ground pork/shallot?) chili sauce that she gave to us along with some black vinegar. Definitely ask for some of that sauces with any order!! It tastes good on everythingâ€¦.

The herbal tea has the right mixture of bitter and sweet. Other places either have it too sweet or too bitter. Itâ€™s so satisfying to wash down everything with the herbal tea at the end of the meal.

Before you go, donâ€™t forget to grab some frozen house-made dumplings to cook for later. We got 30 pieces and it was only $12. The owners were very generous with the fillings. I never want to buy frozen dumplings from grocery stores anymore!

You have these options:
- shrimp wonton
- pork dumpling
- pork chive dumplings

The shrimp wonton and the pork chives are my favorite!
Experience the best chinese noodle place in Brooklyn. The dumplings are amazing. The noodles are godsend.
Some of the most outstanding food Iâ€™ve had recently. I had the basil beef stew with the hand pulled noodles! You need to check this place out!
The food is absolutely delicious. Definitely made with love. Their soy sauce is the best that Iâ€™ve ever had
The special spicy sauce on the minced pork noodle is definitely their signature dish. Pork dumplings and the mama special noodle soup are sure to be recommended. The taste is above average.

Had the fried pork dumplings, Singapore shrimp Mei Fun, and the house special ma ma noodle soup. All were so good on their own, but adding the spicy pork sauce took it to whole other level. Itâ€™s a hole in the wall with very little seating - an absolute gem. Definitely will be going back here!

Decent place for a snack, sometimes wait for food is long since only an elderly couple operating the store. Portions were pretty big, maybe it was cause we went during almost closing hours. The scallion pancake is literally the frozen ones bought in the Chinese supermarket but deep fried and 4x the price lol. I think their dumplings are store bought and deep fried too, not handmade by them.

Posting a review even though I haven't eaten there in a couple months because I miss Mama's.

I used to live a couple blocks down and would get lunch here every Tuesday. Sometimes takeout, sometimes dine in. Mama is a real mama, sometimes I stop by to say hi just to feel a bit of her positive energy. She's very generous and so nurturing you can feel it in the food. I always come out feeling like I've been fed by my own mom.

Everyone should try Mamas at least once in their lives. I usually get the shrimp dumpling in different form or the ma po tofu with rice.
Incredible food at affordable prices. This place is clearly a hidden gem. I highly recommend!
A real hole-in-a-wall restaurant by mom-and-pop, serving authentic Asian eats. Ordered a Basil Beef Stew Ho Fun to dine in and test the hype, 10/10 taste; I immediately ordered another to go.

Iâ€™d be happy to upload a picture before eating everything, but I forgot this time! Iâ€™m usually pretty frugal and try to cook at home, but I never regret coming here to enjoy this amazing food. Itâ€™s so good and deliciousâ€”hard to find anything like it anywhere in the vast city of NYC. Food made with love. Iâ€™m always happy to come back! Thank you!
Great bowl of spicy wontons and pad thai. Top notch. Seats were super comfy. I now want chairs like that In my house lol.
After a long day of moving to a new home. My mom and I came to eat here and I enjoyed my time eating.

The restaurant is located in the Bensonhurst section of Brooklyn.  They prepare Chinese cuisine.  It is very small and located on the side street.  They have several tables for dining in but is basically a takeout.  I ordered the scallion pancake which was thin and flaky.  The curry fish balls were interesting and were in a curry sauce similar to Indian cuisine.  The wonton noodle soup was good but had little soup.  I would recommend additional soup in a separate container.  The hot pot shrimp had a loose spicy sauce with small shrimp and some vegetable.   The mapo tofu was on rice and had a good taste.  The woman answering the phone spoke limited English but was friendly.  I asked for some additional sauces  but it was left out of the order.  They also don't take credit cards which can be inconvenient.
Bland

$4.5-Scallion Pancake 10/10 it was crispy & wasnâ€™t oily, taste better with the curry sauce
$5.5-Fried Pork Dumplings (6) 10/10 it was thick & the chill oily sauce made 10x better
$5-Curry Fish Ball (8) 8.5/10 the curry wasnâ€™t spicy it was flavorful but isnâ€™t worth $5 for only 8
$3-Soy sauce egg (3) 2/10 adding more sauce or letting it sit longer will taste better
$4-(2x)Honey Lemon 4/10 didnâ€™t taste honey & it was a bit bitter from the lemon
Total: $24.50
â—ï¸BEING CASH, or you can just Zelleâ—ï¸
The owner gave us a free Homemade Honey Lemon drink, she was the sweetest personğŸ˜Š
Delicious food and lovely warm people. Definitely worth a trip to Bensonhurst. I'll be back.
God himself came down and blessed Mamas hands to make these food.

The place was nice. The lady who helped us was very nice to me despite my terrible Chinese skills (they can speak English but I wanted to try my Chinese). I went there with my sister and we got the wonton and dumplings noodle soup and the hot pot style noodle. The hot pot style noodle tasted pickled which my sister was not a fan of but thatâ€™s just taste preferences. It wasnâ€™t that spicy but it was still good. The wontons also had shrimp in it but since I am allergic to crustaceans I couldnâ€™t eat all of them sadly and gave them to my sister. They were still good and they were handmade which was cool. The noodles in the wonton noodle soup were soft and came with a very mild and nice soup.

The epitome of a hole-in-the-wall restaurant. At first, this seems like it is just for take out but if you go by yourself or with a small party (less than 5), you might be lucky to eat in. Why eat in? Food is always best when eaten fresh. Take out can never compare.

I went here with two friends and we were blown away by the hospitality shown by the owners and the quality of the noodle soups. This is truly a hidden gem for those who loves a good noodle soup! Eat in if you are the type who loves hole-in-the-wall spots and don't mind the atmosphere, or else just do take out.

I recently visited Mamas Noodle House with a friend and it was such a cozy and welcoming way to spend the evening. Walking in you are instantly greeted with a warm smile by the owners and provided with menus. All the food looked very good so it was hard to decide on something. On top of that the prices are very reasonable. I went with the dumpling noodle with a lemonade to drink. Besides the fact that the dumplings and noodles were so so good, a portion size for two honestly, the lemonade got me hooked. It is freshly made and served in a very cute cup and straw combo. I highly recommend this place and will be coming back for more. Thank you!!!

We stopped by here to grab a quick lunch and it was delicious! I got the chicken pad Thai and my bf got the minced pork noodles. Mine was perfect and my bf liked his as well. I didnâ€™t expect his to have a kick but it was still good. We also got the lemon iced tea and herbal tea and I recommend both!

This was the best beef noodle soup Iâ€™ve had in my life. Gotta try the mama noodle special. Also the spicy wontons and the hot pot fish are to die for. And the herbal tea is really fresh and bomb too. Oh and did I mention the priceâ€¦.youâ€™re not gonna find anything cheaper and this high quality anywhere in NYC. The portions are mad generous and this food is straight bussin!!! People really be sleepin on this place freal freal, Iâ€™m letting yâ€™all in on it right now, donâ€™t sleep!!!
I got the shrimp dumpling soup and it was so good! The lemonade is also very delicious. Very affordable prices and the owners are so nice. Will definitely be coming back. ğŸ¤—
Literally so delicious and such a cute little shop i wish it was closer to me i would go here everyday.

Mama's Noodle House in Brooklyn is a true culinary gem, offering a delectable and budget-friendly Asian dining experience. The menu features a delightful array of Asian flavors, from savory noodle dishes to aromatic stir-fries. What sets Mama's Noodle House apart is not only the deliciousness of their offerings but also the affordability, making it a standout choice for those seeking a satisfying meal without breaking the bank.

This restaurant's excellence has even garnered attention from the media, with features in newspapers highlighting its exceptional culinary offerings. The cozy atmosphere and friendly service further enhance the dining experience, creating a welcoming space for both regulars and newcomers.

In summary, Mama's Noodle House is a must-visit in Brooklyn, celebrated for its mouthwatering dishes, affordability, and recognition in the media. It stands as a testament to the rich and diverse culinary scene thriving in the heart of Brooklyn.

It's simply the best soup in the NYC, period.  It's comfort food. The soup reached your soul. It's homey, like coming into visit a close relative. With that, you immediately feel love from the chefs who just humbly give you one of the best things you ever tasted. I'll dream about the food.

Decent food but they will always forget items  and "forget" to give you change.

Always double check your order and change like the other reviewer shared. They don't separate noodles from soup either for takeout.

Sometimes they'll "gift" fruits only to find out it's rotten. Gave them a few chances but it's not worth the hassle.
This little place is amazing. Food was served fast, and order was taken in no time. My personal favorite things I order are the minced pork noodles, spicy wontons, and also the hotpot fish.
Best beef noodle soup I have ever had and at a good price. Beef was tender and flavorful. You should also try the hot pot fish. And the portions were huge. Love you Mama

Fresh, tasty, and very affordable!

I agree with the other reviews that there is extremely limited seating options, but a sampling of the menu made this a worthwhile stop.

Quick service and prompt food if you're in the area.
Amazing Ma and Pop shop. Always greeted with a smile and warm hearty meal!  The food they serve taste just like something my grandma would serve me as a child. A hidden gem in the Bensonhurst!
